meanings.definition: To give back or return something that was previously given.
meanings.sent1: I will regive the book to the library tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She decided to regive the toy to her little brother.
meanings.sent3: After receiving two gifts, he had to regive one to his friend.
meanings.sent4: The kind gesture of regiving the lost wallet made her day.
meanings.sent5: He promised to regive the borrowed tools as soon as he finished using them.

meanings.definition: To give again; to present once more.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will regive the instructions for the project.
meanings.sent2: They regive the performance every year due to its popularity.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to regive the disappearing act as the audience missed it.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to regive the painting a new touch of color.
meanings.sent5: The chef will regive the cooking demonstration for those who missed it earlier.
